intro: Pentarrhinum fasciculatum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators.
